result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael a Verrilli in Court for Marteace D'Sean Jones.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense has not received medical records and advised the Court of possible Motions. For reasons stated on the record, Court VACATED Jury Trial date of November 14, 2022. Defense requested to address bail. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:59 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding Final PreTrial scheduled for November 4, 2022.
NEW TIME: Final PreTrial scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Information provided to Victim Witness Advocate.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  (Marteace D. Jones - #2022004809, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.

Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael a Verrilli in Court for Marteace D'Sean Jones.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided an update to the Court and requested an adjournment. State confirmed. Court granted Defense request. Additionally, Defense requested to address Bail. Defense to file a Motion. State to comply with Victim Notification. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements.  (Marteace D. Jones - #2022004809, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.  (Marteace D. Jones - #2022004809, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel received discovery material (except recording of Defendants statement) and an offer from the State. Defense counsel requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 9:15 am.Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court, Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones not in court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Defendants appearance waived for todays hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has received Discovery materials and Offer Letter. Defense requesting an adjournment to allow for time to review discovery materials and Offer with Defendant. Court granted request. Court ordered case adjourned for a Status hearing. Court ordered Defense and State to meet at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Recieved and filed: Motion from Defendant.

COURT LOWERED CASH BAIL TO $15,000.00.
Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 3:15 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. Court VACATED Scheduling Conference date of June 21, 2022.

Clerk contacted the parties via email to schedule bail hearing. 
Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:45 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to Victim/Witness Advocates and MCSO.
Defense Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Fetting. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with M.E.Y.,
No contact within 500 feet of W. Center between the intersections of N. 54th Street and W. Center St, and N. 53rd
Street and W. Center St, in the City of Milwaukee.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Marteace D'Sean Jones in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marteace D'Sean Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
